Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Milky \Milk"y\, a. 1. Consisting of, or containing, milk. [1913 Webster]
Pails high foaming with a milky flood. --Pope. [1913 Webster]
2. Like, or somewhat like, milk; whitish and turbid; as, the water is milky. ``Milky juice.'' --Arbuthnot. [1913 Webster]
3. Yielding milk. ``Milky mothers.'' --Roscommon. [1913 Webster]
4. Mild; tame; spiritless. [1913 Webster]
Has friendship such a faint and milky heart? --Shak. [1913 Webster]
{Milky Way}. (Astron.) See {Galaxy}, 1. [1913 Webster]
milky adj : resembling milk in color or cloudiness; not clear; "milky glass" [syn: {milklike}, {whitish}] [also: {milkiest}, {milkier}]
